edu.umass.cs.msocket

Class MSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.Socket
      • edu.umass.cs.msocket.MSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MultipathInterface, Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InternalMSocket

    public class MSocket
extends Socket
implements MultipathInterface
    This class implements the MSocket, applications can use MSocket to connect to a listening server
    Author:
    ayadav

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MSocket.MSocketType
      Denotes the type of connection msocket client wants to establish, MSOCKET_SERVER establishes connection to msocket server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MSocket

        public MSocket()
        Creates an unconnected MSocket.

      • MSocket

        public MSocket(InetAddress address,
               int port,
               InetAddress localAddr,
               int localPort)
        throws IOException
        Creates a socket and connects it to the specified remote address on the specified remote port. The Socket will also bind() to the local address and port supplied. If the specified local address is null then the system will pick the address. A local port number of zero will let the system pick up a free port in the bind operation.
        Parameters:
        address - - the remote address
        port - - the remote port
        localAddr - - the local address the socket is bound to, or null for the anyLocal address.
        the - local port the socket is bound to or zero for a system selected free port.
        Throws:
        IOException - - if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket.

      • MSocket

        public MSocket(String host,
               int port,
               InetAddress localAddr,
               int localPort)
        throws IOException
        Creates a MSocket and connects it to the specified remote host on the specified remote port. The MSocket will also bind() to the local address and port supplied. If the specified host is null it is the equivalent of specifying the address as InetAddress.getByName(null). The it throws an UnknownHostException. A local port number of zero will let the system pick up a free port in the bind operation.
        Parameters:
        host - - the name of the remote host.
        port - - the remote port
        localAddr - - the local address the socket is bound to, or null for the anyLocal address.
        localPort - - the local port the socket is bound to, or zero for a system selected free port.
        Throws:
        IOException - - if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket.

      • MSocket

        public MSocket(String host,
               int port)
        throws UnknownHostException,
               IOException
        Creates a MSocket and connects it to the specified port number on the name. It creates as many flowpaths are there are active interfaces at the device at the time of calling. If the specified host is null it is the equivalent of specifying the address as InetAddress.getByName(null). The it throws an UnknownHostException.
        Parameters:
        host - - the host name, or null for the loopback address.
        port - - the port number.
        Throws:
        UnknownHostException - - if the host is null or can't be resolved in GNS
        IOException - - if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket.

      • MSocket

        public MSocket(InetAddress address,
               int port)
        throws IOException
        Creates a MSocket and connects it to the specified port number at the specified IP address. It creates as many flowpaths are there are active interfaces at the device at the time of calling. If the specified host is null it is the equivalent of specifying the address as InetAddress.getByName(null). In other words, it is equivalent to specifying an address of the loopback interface.
        Parameters:
        address - - the IP address.
        port - - the port number.
        Throws:
        IOException - - if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket.

      • MSocket

        @Deprecated
public MSocket(String host,
                           int port,
                           boolean stream)
                    throws IOException
        Deprecated. 
        Creates MSocket and connects it to the specified port number on the named host. stream flag is ignored and TCP sockets are always created. If the specified host is null it is the equivalent of specifying the address as InetAddress.getByName(null). The it throws an UnknownHostException.
        Parameters:
        host - - the host name
        port - - the port number.
        stream - - flag always ignored.
        Throws:
        IOException - - if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket.
        UnknownHostException - - if host is null or can't be resolved in GNS

      • MSocket

        @Deprecated
public MSocket(InetAddress host,
                           int port,
                           boolean stream)
                    throws IOException
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a MSocket and connects it to the specified port number at the specified IP address. stream argument is ignored and a TCP socket is always created. If the specified host is null it is the equivalent of specifying the address as InetAddress.getByName(null). In other words, it is equivalent to specifying an address of the loopback interface.
        Parameters:
        host - - the IP address.
        port - - the port number.
        stream - - flag always ignored.
        Throws:
        IOException - - if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket.

      • MSocket

        @Deprecated
public MSocket(Proxy proxy)
        Deprecated. 
        Constructor not supported by MSocket, will throw an UnsupportedOperationException
        Parameters:
        proxy -
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException

      • MSocket

        public MSocket(InetAddress address,
               int port,
               MSocket.MSocketType serverType)
        throws IOException
        Creates a MSocket and connects it to the specified port number at the specified IP address. It creates as many flowpaths are there are active interfaces at the device at the time of calling. If the specified host is null it is the equivalent of specifying the address as InetAddress.getByName(null). In other words, it is equivalent to specifying an address of the loopback interface.
        Parameters:
        address - - the IP address.
        port - - the port number.
        Throws:
        IOException - - if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket.

      • connect

        public void connect(SocketAddress endpoint,
                    int timeout)
             throws IOException
        Connects this socket to the server with a specified timeout value. timeout is ignored and it blocks until the connection completes The connection will then block until established or an error occurs.
        Overrides:
        connect in class Socket
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getMultipathPolicy

        public MultipathPolicy getMultipathPolicy()
        Gets the multiPath data Write Policy.
        Returns:

      • setMultipathPolicy

        public void setMultipathPolicy(MultipathPolicy multipathPolicy)
        Sets the multiPath data Write Policy. Choose among MSocket#MULTIPATH_POLICY_RANDOM to randomly send over paths, MSocket#MULTIPATH_POLICY_DEFAULT for an optimized multipath policy, MSocket#MULTIPATH_POLICY_UNIFORM to sends uniformly over all the paths or MSocket#MULTIPATH_POLICY_OUTSTAND_RATIO to choose the least outstanding bytes path, to send the data
        Parameters:
        multipathPolicy - the multipath policy to use

      • bind

        public void bind(List<SocketAddress> bindings)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: MultipathInterface
        Provides a list of IP:port that can be used by flow paths to bind locally. Calling this method multiple times overwrites the values to be used for future flowpaths but it does not change the bindings of currently active flow paths.
        Specified by:
        bind in interface MultipathInterface
        Parameters:
        bindings - list of IP:ports to pick from when creating a new flow path.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • getBindings

        public List<SocketAddress> getBindings()
        Description copied from interface: MultipathInterface
        Return the list of current IP:port used for binding new flow paths locally
        Specified by:
        getBindings in interface MultipathInterface
        Returns:
        list of currently defined bindings

      • addFlowPath

        public FlowPath addFlowPath(SocketAddress binding)
        Description copied from interface: MultipathInterface
        Add a flow path to the current connection. An eventual binding point can be provided to force a specific path to be taken.
        Specified by:
        addFlowPath in interface MultipathInterface
        Parameters:
        binding - local IP:port to bind or null to use the currently defined list of bindings (if no binding is defined, the system will choose an interface automatically)
        Returns:
        a flowpath id or null if the limit of flowpaths has been reached
        See Also:
        MultipathInterface.addFlowPath(java.net.SocketAddress)

      • getActiveFlowPaths

        public List<FlowPath> getActiveFlowPaths()
        Description copied from interface: MultipathInterface
        Returns the list of currently active flow paths.
        Specified by:
        getActiveFlowPaths in interface MultipathInterface
        Returns:
        a list of MSocket representing the different active flowpaths
        See Also:
        MultipathInterface.getActiveFlowPaths()

        Throws:

      • setMaxFlowPath

        public void setMaxFlowPath(int limit)
        Description copied from interface: MultipathInterface
        Set the maximum number of flowpath allowed on this connection. The value must be at least 1.
        Specified by:
        setMaxFlowPath in interface MultipathInterface
        Parameters:
        limit - maximum number of flowpaths

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • migrateFlowPath

        public void migrateFlowPath(FlowPath flowpath,
                            InetAddress localAddress,
                            int localPort)
        Description copied from interface: MultipathInterface
        Migrate a flowpath to the new local interface provided the new IP:port
        Specified by:
        migrateFlowPath in interface MultipathInterface
        Parameters:
        flowpath - the flowpath to migrate
        localAddress - new local address to bind the listening socket
        localPort - new local port to bind the listening socket
